question: Recently, NASA has selected two missions- Dragonfly and Comet Astrobiology Exploration Sample Return (CAESAR) to study which of the following?
option1: Phobos and Deimos- moons of Mars
option2: Titan-the largest moon of Saturn and comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko
option3: Ganymede and Europa- moons of Jupiter
option4: Newly discovered exoplanets Trappist-1 and Ross 128 b
answer: Titan-the largest moon of Saturn and comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko
explanation: NASA has selected two missions to further explore past targets. First is the Mission “Dragonfly” to explore the Saturn's largest moon, Titan. Second is the Mission Comet Astrobiology Exploration Sample Return (CAESAR) to explore the comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko.
